statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: LAS VEGAS HOLIDAY CLASSIC AT VALLEY HS IN LAS VEGAS NV

article.headline: Cincinnati 75, LSU 72
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- James White hit a go-ahead 3-pointer with 1:51 left to lead Cincinnati to a 75-72 win over LSU Friday night in the final round of the Las Vegas Holiday Classic. White, who finished with 19 points, also hit two free throws with 17 seconds left. He scored 11 of the Bearcats' final 14 points. Cincinnati's Eric Hicks also added 21 points. LSU's Garrett Temple missed a potential tying 3-pointer at the buzzer. The Bearcats (9-2) won despite being out-rebounded 38-25 and outscored in the paint, 40-20. The Tigers turned the ball over 23 times to the Bearcats' 14. Devan Downey added 11 points and eight assists for Cincinnati. Hicks also had seven rebounds. Cincinnati and Northern Iowa share the Holiday Classic title with both teams going 4-0 in the round-robin format. Glen Davis led LSU (7-3) with 21 points, going 9-of-15 from the field, while Darrel Mitchell had 17 points. Tyrus Thomas had 12 points and 13 rebounds for the Tigers.
